m_szDocTitle: Spyker Plans To Release All-Electric SUV In 2017
m_szDocSumamry: Spyker Plans To Release All-Electric SUV In 2017 Originally published on EV Obsession . The Dutch company Spyker — a resurrected form of the automotive and aircraft company that used the name back in the 1920s — is planning to release an all-electric version of the company’s D12 Peking-to-Paris concept car (revealed all the way back in 2006) in 2017, according to recent reports. The company will be unveiling the new electric SUV at the upcoming 2016 Los Angeles Auto Show in November, going by recent comments made by Volta Volaré CEO and founder Paul Peterson to Motor Authority.
